column4: control-alt-backspace is dangerous... it should warn you before just killing your login session
if it warns you.. and your mouse doesnt move...
ctrl+alt+backspace has been around a long time though....
that's nice, but if ubuntu is supposed to be a general replacement for consumer desktops, having that keystroke in it is Bad
well... id rather have it.. when buggy gui apps decide to lock everything up
if it can be enabled specifically by those who want it, fine. if it's a default, Bad
guess we should disable alt+sysctrl then...
does special debug stuff by directly interfacing with the kernel
for example.. alt+sysctrl+b instantly reboots your computer (unsafe shutdown)
yep, that should be enabled only when wanted, by developers and the like
just think about your grandmother using it... she hits the wrong keys and bang... all her work is gone
blue screens are a fatal error, obviously not the same thing at all
except, you can design a system that never crashes
not the fatal kernel error kind at least
so why not just do it?
